article.title: 9 Best Things To Do In Chumphon, Thailand
article.lead_paragraph:
A unique town, Chumphon is located in Southern Thailand, just outside of Bangkok. This is a great location for culture and beauty, and it is also central to other towns within Chumphon Province. Here, you will find a lively nightlife and markets throughout, where you can experience amazing and authentic Thai food.

Read on to find out about the things to do in Chumphon, Thailand.
article.proposal: 1)  Chumphon National Museum.  2)  Wat Phra That - Buddhist temple in Sawi.  3)  Krom Luang Chumphon Khet Udomsak Royal Palace.  4)  Chumphon night market.  5)  Tham Khwan Mueang Temple.  6)  Siam Catamaran Cave Exploring Adventure  7)  Phato Canal Rafting.  8)  Thung Wua Laen Beach (Hat Thung Wua Laen).  9)  Chumphon National Park Scuba Diving Tours
article.meta_description: Thailand is known for its stunning beaches and vibrant culture and Chumphon, capital of Chumphon Province, is a most welcoming city, with much to offer!

snippets.text: 1.  Chumphon National Museum

Chumphon National Museum is a very informative museum, with artifacts dating back as far as 4000 years! Tools, bowls, jewelry and artwork are among some of the fantastic items on display, here. The museum includes interactive displays of architecture, history, culture and military pieces. This museum is educational and truly informs you of the history of Chumphon, as well as the prehistoric wonders of our earth.


>##### Chumphon National Museum
>
> **Address**:  Na Cha-ang, Mueang Chumphon District, Chumphon 86000, Thailand
>
> **Website**:  [Chumphon National Museum](https://www.tourismthailand.org/Attraction/Chumphon-National-Museum--5548)
>
2.   Wat Phra That Buddhist Temple

Wat Phra That Buddhist Temple is rated with excellent reviews. It's a mystical and beautiful experience, right from the beginning and those who visit are never disappointed. Explore the local traditions throughout the temple and taste the local cuisine, just outside the temple! The views are absolutely breathtaking, and this destination is a must see.

>#####  Wat Phra That Buddhist Temple
>
>**Address**:  190/1 หมู่ที่ 7 Tambon Sawi, Amphoe Sawi, Chang Wat Chumphon 86190, Thailand
>
>**Website**:  [Wat Phra That Buddhist Temple](http://thailandforvisitors.com/isan/nakhon-phanom/that-phanom/wat-phra-that-phanom.php)
>
3.  Krom Luang Chumphon Khet Udomsak Royal Palace

This is an authentic palace, with stunning views of Sai Ree Beach. Many locals frequent this temple to pay their respects and light traditional firecrackers. There is a lot to see here, and the Royal Palace has excellent reviews. When you visit Thailand, it's important to visit the temples, as they offer so much history and culture and visiting Krom Luang Chumphon Khet Udomsak Royal Palace will offer you that, plus more!

>#####  Krom Luang Chumphon Khet Udomsak Royal Palace
>
>**Address**:  Hat Sai Ri, Mueang Chumphon District, Chumphon 86120, Thailand
>
>**Website**:  [Krom Luang Chumphon Khet Udomsak Royal Palace](https://www.tripadvisor.com.ph/Attraction_Review-g616039-d7188160-Reviews-Krom_Luang_Chumphon_Khet_Udomsak_Royal_Palace-Chumphon_Chumphon_Province.html#REVIEWS)
>
4.  Chumphon Night Market

The Chumphon Night Market offers you the best way to experience true Chumphon! The street food is phenomenal and the sights, sounds and smells will keep your senses stimulated, while everyone around you will provide you with the authentic and true Thailand you're looking for. The market is full of excitement, and reflects the vibrancy of the city! The best part is, you can watch the food being cooked right in front you in steaming hot pans. I always find street markets to be the greatest way to experience the rich culture and heritage of the places you visit!  And this night market offers it all!

>##### Chumphon Night Market
>
>**Address**:  Tha Taphao, Mueang Chumphon District, Chumphon 86000, Thailand
>
5.  Tham Khwan Mueang Temple

This temple is quite large, offering so much to see, and so much to explore. Stairs lead to a beautiful view of tropical coconut and palm plantation fields - such a lush and rich way to see the true tropical land of Chumphon. The air is fresh and fragrant here, with tropical breezes, offering breathtaking views. Tham Khwan Mueang Temple is definitely worth the journey.

>#####  Tham Khwan Mueang Temple
>
>**Address**:  130/2 Pracha Khwan Mueang Road, Tambon Na Pho, Amphoe Sawi, Chumphon 86130, Thailand
>
>**Website**:  [Tham Khwan Mueang Temple](https://www.routeyou.com/en-th/location/view/48658175/wat-phra-that-tham-khwan-mueang)
>
6.   Siam adventure world

This tour consists of seven stops along the Phi Phi islands and each offers unique and stunning beauty. Included in the tour is breakfast, light snacks, lunch on a deserted island and snorkeling opportunities. If you want to add a little adventurism to your holiday, then Siam Adventure World will provide you with all the exploring opportunities you need! Siam Adventure World is a remarkable opportunity to visit those exotic and remote islands of Thailand, with picture-perfect postcard beauty. This is definitely paradise...


>#####  Siam Adventure World
>
>**Address**:  Koh Keaw, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83000, Thailand
>
>**Website:** [Siam Adventure World](http://siamadventureworld.com/)
7.  Phato canal rafting

snippets.html: A post shared by Per Erik Sleipner (@per_erik_sleipner) on Oct 8, 2016 at 5:10am PDT

snippets.text:
If you're still feeling adventurous, this rafting expedition is definitely something to add to your 'things-to-do' list! Imagine rafting through the luxurious forests surrounding the canals and coasting over the rapids, while absorbing the sites from all around. Camping and elephant riding is also available. 

>##### Phato Canal Rafting
>
>**Address**: Phato, Phato District, Chumphon 86180, Thailand
>
>**Website:** [Phato Canal Rafting](https://www.tourismthailand.org/Attraction/Phato-Canal-Rafting--5611)
>
8.  Thung Wua Laen Beach (Hat Thung Wua Laen)

One of the many stunning beaches here in Chumphon, Thung Wua Laen Beach is a luxurious stop, found within Pathio District. It is a very peaceful beach, somewhat away from the hustle and bustle of Chumphon city. The regulations are strict in keeping the beach beautiful and lawn chairs and jet skis are not permitted here. This is the perfect place for a personal spiritual retreat!  

>#####  Thung Wua Laen Beach (Hat Thung Wua Laen)
>
>**Address**:  Saphli, Pathio District, Chumphon 86230, Thailand
>
>**Website**:  [Thung Wua Laen Beach](http://www.thungwualaenbeach.com/thung-wua-laen.html)
>
9.  Chumphon National Park

Mountain ranges, islands and canyons are just a few of the stunning features of Chumphon National Park. Consisting of marine areas, beaches and an archipelago of 41 stunning tropical islands, Chumphon National Park is one destination where you can experience plenty of everything. You will also be in proximity to tropical rainforests, beach forests and a limestone mountain forest. This is another spectacular way to enjoy incredible tropical breezes, fresh sea air and the beauty of nature that surrounds you.


>##### Chumphon National Park
>
>**Address**:  Hat Sai Ri, Muang Chumphon, Chumphon 86000 Thailand
>
>**Website**:  [Chumphon National Park](http://www.bangkokpost.com/travel/sightseeing/5801/mu-ko-chumphon-national-park)
>
The beauty of Chumphon, Thailand

Thailand's mystical temples and breathtaking beaches can be found right here, in Chumphon. It's a magical place, offering authentic cuisine to enjoy during your stay, while you immerse yourself in the culture of this amazing city! Exploring, adventure and relaxation are all within close proximity of this lovely town, with tropical rainforests, canyons, caves, temples and views that are out of this world. Chumphon is a destination in Thailand that you will not want to miss!

navigator.introduction:
Kathy Lum is from Vancouver, Canada. She loves being Canadian, and greatly enjoys calling herself a freelance writer! In fact, she considers it one of her great loves in life. She not only enjoys travel writing but with a background in psychology, she also writes and publishes articles on health and mental wellness.  Kathy loves New York City, but also loves quiet villages and seaside towns as well.  She looks very forward to venturing into global volunteering within the near future!
You can find out more about Kathy Lum at one of her two websites; "Write, Love and Travel"  http://frugaltravels.org/ and "Health, Love and Wellness" https://walkvancouverblog.wordpress.com/.
